(3) OpenAPI: The Big Picture



OpenAPI as a Machine-Readable Format Erik Wilde: API Management in Practice: Introduction to OpenAPI

(4) OpenAPI is Structured Data

  • APIs described by OpenAPI are described in a structured way
  • Resources [Resources: URI Paths (1)], interactions [Interactions: Operations and Parameters (1)], and representations [Representations: Requests and Responses (1)] are core concepts
  • OpenAPI must use a structured way to describe these concepts


OpenAPI as a Machine-Readable Format Erik Wilde: API Management in Practice: Introduction to OpenAPI

(5) OpenAPI Object Structure



OpenAPI as a Machine-Readable Format Erik Wilde: API Management in Practice: Introduction to OpenAPI

(6) Minimal OpenAPI in JSON 

{ "openapi": "3.1.0",
  "info": {
    "title": "Greeting API",
    "version": "1.0.0",
    "description": "A simple API to return a greeting message."
  },
  "paths": {
    "/greet": {
      "get": {
        "summary": "Returns a greeting message",
        "responses": {
          "200": {
          "description": "A successful response",
          "content": {
            "application/json": {
              "schema": {
                "type": "object",
                "properties": {
                  "message": {
                    "type": "string",
                    "examples":
                      ["Hello, world!"] }}}}}}}}}}}
  • greet.json


OpenAPI as a Machine-Readable Format Erik Wilde: API Management in Practice: Introduction to OpenAPI

(7) Minimal OpenAPI in YAML 

openapi: 3.1.0
info:
  title: Greeting API
  version: 1.0.0
  description: A simple API to return a greeting message.

paths:
  /greet:
    get:
      summary: Returns a greeting message
      responses:
        '200':
          description: A successful response
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                type: object
                properties:
                  message:
                    type: string
                    examples:
                      - Hello, world!
  • greet.yaml


OpenAPI as a Machine-Readable Format Erik Wilde: API Management in Practice: Introduction to OpenAPI

OpenAPI Superstructure: Resources, Interactions, and Representations Erik Wilde: API Management in Practice: Introduction to OpenAPI

(11) Shaping Your API

  • Resources are the fundamental units of interaction
  • Interactions are how you access resources
  • Representations define how interactions exchange information

Resources: URI Paths Erik Wilde: API Management in Practice: Introduction to OpenAPI

(13) Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) 

https://openapis.org/events
  • Individual resources are identified by uniformly defined identifiers
  • Tasks are completed by traversing a number of resources
  • Scheme defines how identifiers are assigned: https
  • Authority defines a naming authority: openapis.org
  • Path is a hierarchical namespace: /events


Resources: URI Paths Erik Wilde: API Management in Practice: Introduction to OpenAPI

(14) OpenAPI: Organized by Resources



Resources: URI Paths Erik Wilde: API Management in Practice: Introduction to OpenAPI

(15) OpenAPI Editors



Resources: URI Paths Erik Wilde: API Management in Practice: Introduction to OpenAPI

(16) Evolving APIs by Adding Paths

  • Evolving APIs over time is a good practice
  • Changing an API should not affect existing consumers
  • Adding paths is a good way to avoid breaking changes

Interactions: Operations and Parameters Erik Wilde: API Management in Practice: Introduction to OpenAPI

(18) Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP)

  • The language how clients and servers communicate
  • Request/response model where the client always initiates the interaction
  • Each request has a request method (e.g., GET)
  • Each response has a response status (e.g., 200 OK)
  • Requests and responses use header fields for metadata
  • Requests and responses can have a message body


Interactions: Operations and Parameters Erik Wilde: API Management in Practice: Introduction to OpenAPI

GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: www.openapis.org
  • openapis-org-request.txt

Server: nginx
Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31622400
Date: Fri, 19 Jul 2024 14:59:04 GMT

<!doctype html>
<html lang="en-US">
<head>

Interactions: Operations and Parameters Erik Wilde: API Management in Practice: Introduction to OpenAPI

(22) Parameters in URIs and HTTP

  • A simple way to send data from client to server
  • path: Embedded in URI (https://github.com/octocat)
  • query: Appended to URI (https://github.com/octocat?tab=repositories)
  • header: Sent as HTTP header field
  • cookie: Sent as part of HTTP cookie management
  • Larger data needs to be sent in HTTP message body


Interactions: Operations and Parameters Erik Wilde: API Management in Practice: Introduction to OpenAPI

(23) Path Parameters in OpenAPI 

paths:
  "/users/{username}":
    get:
      summary: Get a user
      operationId: users/get-by-username
      parameters:
        - name: username
          description: The handle for the GitHub user account.
          in: path
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
  • github-get-by-username.yaml (line 1-12)
GET https://api.github.com/users/octocat


Interactions: Operations and Parameters Erik Wilde: API Management in Practice: Introduction to OpenAPI

(24) Query Parameters in OpenAPI 

paths:
  "/users":
    get:
      summary: List users
      operationId: users/list
      parameters:
        - name: since
          description: A user ID. Only return users with an ID greater than this ID.
          in: query
          required: false
          schema:
            type: integer
        - name: per_page
          description: The number of results per page (max 100).
          in: query
          schema:
            type: integer
            default: 30
  • github-users-list.yaml
GET https://api.github.com/users?since=1&per_page=20

(26) Data Exchange with HTTP APIs

  • URI and HTTP parameters (path, query, header/cookie)
  • Media Types (rooted in Email and Browsers)
  • JSON (rooted in shared structured data)


Representations: Requests and Responses Erik Wilde: API Management in Practice: Introduction to OpenAPI

(27) Identifying Resource Types on the Internet

  • Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) started in 1992
  • Media Types became the new terminology in 1996
  • Identification for well-known content types (~2000)
    • Text: plain text, HTML, â¦
    • Images: JPEG, PNG, GIF, â¦
    • Application: PDF, XML, JSON, â¦
  • Many APIs have domain-specific data models


Representations: Requests and Responses Erik Wilde: API Management in Practice: Introduction to OpenAPI

(28) API Response with Media Type 

paths:
  "/users/{username}":
    get:
      summary: Get a user
      operationId: users/get-by-username
      parameters:
        - name: username
          description: The handle for the GitHub user account.
          in: path
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
      responses:
        '200':
          description: Response
          content:
            application/pdf: {}
  • github-get-by-username-pdf.yaml


Representations: Requests and Responses Erik Wilde: API Management in Practice: Introduction to OpenAPI

(29) Web-level Structured Data

  • JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) for exchanging structured data
  • application/json says nothing about the data itself
  • JSON Schema for describing valid structured data
  • OpenAPI uses JSON Schema for describing structured data


Representations: Requests and Responses Erik Wilde: API Management in Practice: Introduction to OpenAPI

(30) API Response: Structured Data 

{
  "login": "octocat",
  "id": 1,
  "node_id": "MDQ6VXNlcjE=",
  "avatar_url": "https://github.com/images/error/octocat_happy.gif",
  "gravatar_id": "",
  "url": "https://api.github.com/users/octocat",
  "html_url": "https://github.com/octocat",
  "followers_url": "https://api.github.com/users/octocat/followers",
  "following_url": "https://api.github.com/users/octocat/following{/other_user}",
  "gists_url": "https://api.github.com/users/octocat/gists{/gist_id}",
  "starred_url": "https://api.github.com/users/octocat/starred{/owner}{/repo}",
  "subscriptions_url": "https://api.github.com/users/octocat/subscriptions",
  "organizations_url": "https://api.github.com/users/octocat/orgs",
  "repos_url": "https://api.github.com/users/octocat/repos",
  • octocat.json (line 1-15)


Representations: Requests and Responses Erik Wilde: API Management in Practice: Introduction to OpenAPI

(31) API Response with Media Type 

paths:
  "/users/{username}":
    get:
      summary: Get a user
      operationId: users/get-by-username
      parameters:
        - name: username
          description: The handle for the GitHub user account.
          in: path
          required: true
          schema:
            type: string
      responses:
        '200':
          description: Response
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                oneOf:
                  - "$ref": "#/components/schemas/private-user"
                  - "$ref": "#/components/schemas/public-user"
  • github-get-by-username.yaml


Representations: Requests and Responses Erik Wilde: API Management in Practice: Introduction to OpenAPI

(32) JSON Schema for JSON Data 

public-user:
  title: Public User
  description: Public User
  type: object
  properties:
    login:
      type: string
    id:
      type: integer
      format: int64
    node_id:
      type: string
    avatar_url:
      type: string
      format: uri
    gravatar_id:
      type:
        - string
        - 'null'
  • github-public-user.yaml (line 1-19)


Representations: Requests and Responses Erik Wilde: API Management in Practice: Introduction to OpenAPI

(33) Receiving Data on the Web: Responses



Representations: Requests and Responses Erik Wilde: API Management in Practice: Introduction to OpenAPI

(34) OpenAPI Components: Don't Repeat Yourself

  • Many concepts/models in APIs are reused
  • Concepts may also be reused across various APIs
  • Avoiding copy/paste always is a good idea
  • components allows to define reusable building blocks
  • components supports 10 types of building blocks
    • pathItems, schemas, responses, parameters, examples, â¦


Representations: Requests and Responses Erik Wilde: API Management in Practice: Introduction to OpenAPI

(35) 30'000 ft View of OpenAPI 3.1.0

  • openapi: Defines which spec version is used
  • info: Provides metadata about the API
  • servers: Information about available servers
  • paths: Paths and operations for the API
  • webhooks: Support for server-initiated interactions
  • components: Reusable components for the description
  • security: Declaration of security mechanisms
  • tags: Used for grouping concepts across the API
  • externalDocs: Additional external documentation


Representations: Requests and Responses Erik Wilde: API Management in Practice: Introduction to OpenAPI

(36) OpenAPI: The Easy Bits 

openapi: 3.1.0
info:
  version: 1.1.4
  title: GitHub v3 REST API
  description: GitHub's v3 REST API.
  license:
    name: MIT
    url: https://spdx.org/licenses/MIT
  termsOfService: https://docs.github.com/articles/github-terms-of-service
  contact:
    name: Support
    url: https://support.github.com/contact?tags=dotcom-rest-api
servers:
  - url: https://api.github.com
externalDocs:
  description: GitHub v3 REST API
  url: https://docs.github.com/rest/
  • github-preamble.yaml


An Overview of OpenAPI: Conclusions

An Overview of OpenAPI: Conclusions Erik Wilde: API Management in Practice: Introduction to OpenAPI

(38) An Overview of OpenAPI: Summary

  • OpenAPI describes API that are based on the web model
  • The high-level model of OpenAPI is relatively simple
  • The lower-level details of OpenAPI get more involved
  • OpenAPI can deal with large APIs or collections of APIs
